Linus, Luke, and Dan open up about the privacy precautions they actually use, ranging from fake personas and addresses to... doing basically nothing. They weigh the value of VPNs, talk about the illusion of digital security, and debate whether locking your windows matters when the front door's already wide open.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MI7crSCITts

title: Linus has nothing to hide

Google is killing smart features on first and second-gen Nest thermostats, including app control and learning capabilities. Linus and Luke discuss whether a 14-year lifespan is enough, the ethics of disabling paid features, and why cloud-connected hardware keeps becoming e-waste before it physically breaks.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MI7crSCITts

NASA is facing a massive 25% budget cut under the U.S. government’s 2026 proposal, marking the end of programs like SLS, Orion, and the Mars Sample Return. Linus and Luke unpack what this means for space exploration, technological innovation, and why NASA’s decline might affect more than just rocket launches.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MI7crSCITts

Giant Bomb hits pause, Respawn’s Titanfall game gets axed, and dozens of talented developers are laid off across EA, Valnet, and more. Linus and Luke break down the collapse of mid-size studios, why even successful devs get fired, and the harsh reality of "selling out" in gaming, from a place of fear or power.
